entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 4:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Very Hot Weekend Over The Eastern Interior... ...High Water On The Tanana River Into Next Week... The Eastern Interior will become warmer and drier over the weekend with isolated afternoon thunderstorms. Temperatures will rise into the 80s over most of the Eastern Interior on Saturday, and into the 80s and low 90s on Sunday and Monday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marshall and southwestern DeKalb Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 730 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grant, or 10 miles northeast of Guntersville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Madison and northeastern Limestone Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 714 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Ardmore, or 8 miles north of Athens, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.
